H0.text: In the Muslim religion what name is given to an invisible spirit that appears in either human or 'animal form. Marid

H1.text: In the Muslim religion what name is given to an invisible spirit that appears in either human or 'animal form. Ifrit

H2.text: In the Muslim religion what name is given to an invisible spirit that appears in either human or 'animal form. Shaitan

H3.text: In the Muslim religion what name is given to an invisible spirit that appears in either human or 'animal form. جني

A4.text: They are capable of shapeshifting, usually choosing to appear as snakes, but also as scorpions, lizards, or humans.

A5.text: Jinn were considered a third class of invisible beings, often neutral or morally ambiguous, not consequently equated with devils.
